runs.comm: good pace outside off stump, Maddy rocks back and dabs into the off side to get off the mark
far too much width from Bond, and too short as well. That's slapped past point to launch Solanki's innings
tighter to the stumps, good pace again. Defended back up the pitch
full and nips off the seam into Solanki's pads. Maddy, backing up a long way, might have been in trouble if point had been quicker on the swoop
cracked out to point, but well cut off
right up in the blockhole and dug out to mid-off. Sensible shot selection and a decent start from England
full and gently swinging away from a limp prod
on leg stump and whipped to backward square with a flourish. Can't beat the sweeper though
full and straight, punched to midwicket where Ross Taylor makes a hash of a sliding stop. A gift of an extra run there
Solanki steps back and across and sends Taylor sprawling again with a firm clip into space at midwicket. He's looking busy at the crease
a swing and a miss. The slip has gone already to reinforce the leg-side
full length and punched with exceptional timing back down the ground, and mid-off can't cut it off. A good, confident start for England
jabbed down into the crease, and hustled through for a single
a fraction shorter and lifting into a defensive bat. A loud shout of "noo!" sends Maddy scurrying back to his crease
that one whistled through at an excellent pace. Solanki in no-man's land
excellent pace again. Solanki can't get good bat on ball in this over, but he does rotate the strike
zips off the pitch and straight past Maddy's airy drive
full and speared into the pads, another extra but an excellent over nonetheless
short and pulled - completely mistimed but a top-edge lobs clear of the keeper and runs away for a couple
sharp pace and lift, Maddy sways inside the line and waves his bat at it, but it's took quick for him. 86mph, apparently
full length and driven down the ground, completely bisecting the two straight men. Chris Martin slides to stop, but drags the ball over as his feet touch the rope
dabbed out to point, where it's fielded comfortably. Comfortable start so far ...
straight and quick, but deflected off the back foot into the gully, and another single to the tally
excellent strike, a fraction short and just enough width for Solanki to use his supple wrists and back-cut that into the gap at third man. Well played Vikram, England continue to tick along
thumped! Maddy does that day in, day out in domestic Twenty20s, but that's the first time he's done it in this competition. Too full, and thumped over midwicket
shorter this time, and dropped with soft hands into the off side. Good batting
slower ball, and Solanki is completely deceived. Far too early on it, and the keeper tidies up
back on a regular line and length. Defended with a dead bat
full and fast, excellent response to adversity. No room for manoeuvre
good finish to the over. Line, length, pace, the works. Even so, that was another comfortable over for England's openers. They've given their side a very handy platform
too short, but cracked too firmly and straight to the leg-side sweeper
audacious strike from Solanki, who rocks back and whips a pull shot behind square and into the gap. Very good going indeed
nudged down to third man to rotate the strike
too short again from Oram, and no bounce at all either. A bona fide long-hop, and Maddy deposits it behind square again
different line, same result. Maddy uses the extra lift on an off-stump delivery to help it up and over, and away to third man
pulled behind square for another single. Thoughts about a second, but no need in the circumstances. Great over for England. Plenty for Daniel Vettori to ponder. When will he come into the attack?
too wide once again, and that's clobbered to the point boundary. Runs coming thick and fast now
stand-and-deliver stuff from Maddy. A free swing at a full delivery, which plugs behind the bowler's head and runs away towards the boundary's edge
clubbed into the covers, real intent in England's strokeplay now
Solanki shapes to cut, but the ball's not quite there for the shot. Wide enough, but doesn't bounce much
width again, and cut to third man
dabbed down to third man with a roll of the wrists
down on one knee for a pre-meditated sweep, but Chris Martin on the 45 can't stoop low enough
looped onto a good length, and respectfully dabbed down the pitch
shorter this time, and cut away to a diving point
driven, in the air, and straight down the throat of Lou Vincent at long-off! The captain has the breakthrough, and a very timely one for New Zealand as well
hint of an inside edge as Maddy reaches forward to defend. End of a lovely over from Vettori, and England have a bit of regrouping to do
pushed onto the back foot, a tame defensive stroke. Well, he's entitled to a sighter
on the front foot this time, and carefully steered down to mid-off
onto the back foot, and a clip into the gap in the covers earns KP his first run
short, but zips through as Maddy drops to one knee and attempts to deposit that onto the grandstand roof. Pietersen saunters down for a quiet word
a gentle steer into the covers, and an easy one becomes an excellent two thanks to some aggressive running from Pietersen
full and outside off stump, and punched into the leg-side
down on one knee for the sweep, but not timed
sweeping again, but connects this time, straight to backward square on the boundary's edge
more good running, as Maddy hustles through for two after a clip to deep midwicket
nudged into the gap. KP's playing it cool so far
finds the gap in the covers again, more rotation of the strike
a pre-meditated sweep from Pietersen as he steps outside his off stump, but can't beat the fielder at backward square
width from Martin. Almost too wide for Pietersen to cash in. His carve through the covers comes off a toe-end and is easily fielded at deep cover
that is simply massive. Massive! Short, and swung away, clears the midwicket stand by ten metres!
dabbed into the covers and that's a cracking half-century from Darren Maddy. Just 31 deliveries, and he's put England in a strong position

oh dear, that's a tame end to a fine innings. Pietersen whipped through midwicket, Maddy was off like a tracer bullet, but the ball went straight to the fielder, McMillan, who coolly rolled the ball back to the non-striker's stumps
short but good lift, Pietersen tries to bludgeon through the covers but doesn't time it
thumped with good timing, but can't find the gap in the off side
driven sedately to long-on
Collingwood steps back and then pulls the ball through midwicket
a big swing and a thwack but not timed, the ball trundles to long-on
Collingwood back and punches to wide long-on, he calls for two but it was never on and Pietersen, the king of the quick run, is not interested
turned into the leg side
long hop but Collingwood doesn't get hold of it and it goes along the ground to the man at cow corner
short, pulled and McMillan takes a peach of a catch at midwicket, leaping high to his right ... he never took off but it was a super catch nonetheless
wide, hit into the ground and the ball loops to point
another single ... seven runs off the last nine balls, and this is when New Zealand were starting to accelerate
"horrible" groans Jenny, and rightly, but they all count. A heave, a thick edge and the ball flies down to where third man would usually be
and that was as outstanding as the previous shot was vile ... full and driven with as power as you will ever see, it went five yards to the right of long-off but the fielder never moved
and another power shot, swung from off stump over cow corner where it's brilliantly caught  by a man in a yellow t-shirt, high above his head, on the grassy knoll
steered into the on side, Shah more than happy to give Pietersen the strike
full, Pietersen tries a reverse sweep to a quicker ball, misses and is bowled through his legs ... Vettori does a Panesar-like sprint towards the departing batsman
slower ball, Flintoff goes back and pushes into the covers

a setback starts to become a crisis ... a dreadful mix-up and Flintoff ends up stranded in the middle of the pitch ... both set off, Shah stopped, started, and then stopped but Flintoff, like an oil tanker, is never going to turn on a sixpence
worked to point
flicked on the walk to wide long-on, "two" is the call but there was only ever one
into the off side, an easy one
driven back at the bowler who can only half stop, the ball rebounds into the leg side off the non-striker's foot
short, wide, a gift, Wright slams it over the infield and four all the way square of the wicket
he tries another slog over the top but misses
Wright goes down on one knee and drives straight and way over the man at long-off , into the sightscreen ... a delay as they look for the ball amid all the back cloth
slower ball, driven to long-on
he leans back and hammers the ball to deep cover
Shah dug the ball out, it bobbled to long-on and the pair ran really well, a slow attack by the fielder making their job less risky. Vettori gives a hard stare
turned square on the leg side, this time a mass of fielders converge
dribbled into the covers
short and wide, again leathered through the covers, Oram makes a sliding stop on the boundary edge
Shah reversed the bat and paddled that into space on the leg side, the man in the deep had a long way to come and Shah sprinted back for the second
full, driven between cover and extra cover
full toss dispatched with real ease into the grassy knoll at wide long-on
another full toss, but swinging into Shah and he can only work it into the off side
a swing and a heave loops over extra cover ... ugly, but at this stage in this format, all that matters is the end result
driven from the crease through extra cover, New Zealand now beginning to pick up in the field

dropped full toss smashed back into Oram's midriff, he spills the chance but he looks less than happy with life ... he had a serious finger injury going into the World Cup and he's heading straight off
flicked off leg stump to the man in the deep square on the leg side
full, squeezed off the bottom of the bat to deepish point
Wright gives the charge but can only punch the ball to extra cover
dropped pulled high into the leg side, Ross Taylor at deep midwicket gets right under it but it bounces out of his hand, into his chin and then onto the ground
patted into the off side
hit straight down the ground, Vincent sprints round from long-off and makes a superb, one-handed diving stop on the boundary edge

full, driven to Vettori at extra cover, he misfields, the batsmen chance the second and Shah has to throw himself full length as the ball zips in to McCullum ... Shah slides but he looks to be an inch short ... had his bat not been the wrong way round with the back on the ground then he might just have made it
he thumps the ball high over the covers, Jeehan Patel, on for the injured Oram, doesn't have to move at deep cover and he takes a routine catch
a very horrible heave, the ball scoots into the leg side
slower ball, clipped to short fine leg
full toss, smashed towards the cover boundary, Patel, who had to adjust a couple of times as the ball swirled, takes a well-judged catch five yards in from the edge
well-aimed bouncer, Schofield fends it into the off side and ambles a single
just what New Zealand did not want at this stage ... a gifted run, wide down the leg side
driven hard at Styris square on the off side ... the ball bobbles unkindly but he keeps his eye on it and does well
full, driven hard down the ground, long-on makes sure he stops it and fires in a pinpoint throw ...
heaved off middle stump to the right of long-on, that allows them to come back for the second ... but that's not enough
Schofield swings but doesn't get hold of it, Broad hurtles back for the second and just beats a weak throw
slow full toss, Schofield pulls through midwicket off the bottom of the bat. no power and deep midwicket cleans up
another full toss swung into the leg side, but once more the batsman can't find the gap, they come back for the second but that doesn't matter one jot
